demos.title: Using Bing and Google Layers with Leaflet
demos.description: This demo takes the be Leaflet “Hello World” examples and adds layers for Google and Bing.

demos.title: ArcGIS Earthquake Data
demos.description: This example is the “Hello World” of mapping, the USGS feed of earthquakes for the past 7 days. I used the feed from late July, 2013, to create this earthquake map for one of the lessons in the Geospatial Revolution course.

demos.title: Mapbox Example
demos.description: This example is the “Hello World” of mapping, the USGS feed of earthquakes for the past 7 days. I used the feed from late July, 2013, to create this earthquake map for one of the lessons in the Geospatial Revolution course.

demos.title: Rendering a GeoJSON layer in Leaflet
demos.wordpressUrl: Rendering a GeoJSON layer in Leaflet
demos.description: This example is the “Hello World” of mapping, the USGS feed of earthquakes for the past 7 days. I used the feed from late July, 2013, to create this earthquake map for one of the lessons in the Geospatial Revolution course.

demos.title: GeoJSON Feature Collection
demos.wordpressUrl: How to Display Feature Collection GeoJson with Leafletâ€™s Marker Clusters
demos.description:
This example is the “Hello World” of mapping, the USGS feed of earthquakes for the past 7 days. I used the feed from late July, 2013, to create this earthquake map for one of the lessons in the Geospatial Revolution course.

It also demonstrates Leaflet's Marker Cluster plugin. The marker cluster map layer is used as a wrapper around the GeoJSON layer.

Finally, this demo shows a click listener on the popup to drill down into the activity. The marker cluster layer is replaced by a Leaflet GeoJSON map layer built from an activity's GeoJSON. The “Return to Search” links swaps the maplayers back again.

demos.title: Armed Conflict in Africa
demos.description: This demo uses the PruneCluster plugin to cluster over 99,000 incidents of armed conflict in Africa between 1971 and 2014 from the ACLED 1971 - 2014 dataset. The accompanying blog post will follow soon.

demos.title: Leaflet-PIP Plugin
demos.wordpressUrl: Breaking Dependence on Vendor Map APIs with Leaflet
demos.description: This demo uses a GeoJSON file containing Kansas counties and some overlapping shaps to show how shape events can be handled. It also introduces the Leaflet-PIP Plugin.

demos.title: “50-State Club” map
demos.description: This demo uses the uses Leaflet-PIP Plugin to generate a 50-State Marathon Club style map on the fly in the web browser.

demos.title: Privacy Geofencing
demos.description: This demo shows privacy geofencing done on the browser-side. It is only this way because this is a static website. In the real world, privacy Geofencing would only be done on the server-side so that no private coordinates are delivered in the JSON payload as it is in the demo.
